editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.title: Table of contents
msItem.note: s. xv, as far as art. 14 in the hand of art. 9, then in another hand to art. 22. In place of art. 17 is ‘Item declaracio urbium et ciu’ que ponuntur in biblia ubique in quibus regionibus situantur et idem ponitur statim post Omelias et idem omnino post parabolas Salomonis et est declaracio Bede’.
Another table is on fol. i in a hand of s. xvii; fol. iv blank.

msItem.author: BEDE
msItem.title: De Tabernaculo
msItem.incipit: Moyses in montem Domini ...; Incipit exposicio uenerabilis Bede presbiteri de tabernaculo ...;
Locuturi iuuante Domino de figura tabernaculi et uasorum atque utensilium eius
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber tercius de tabernaculo testimonii beati Bede presbiteri.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Epistola ad Plecguinum
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola eiusdem de sex etatibus seculi
msItem.incipit: Fratri dilectissimo et in Christi uisceribus honorando Plegwino
Venit ad me ante biduum nuncius tue sanctitatis
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit epistola uenerabilis Bede presbiteri ad Flegwinum de sex etatibus seculi.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: De Templo Salomonis
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola Bede ad Notelmum de templo Salomonis.
msItem.incipit: Hortatur nos uas electionis
msItem.explicit: quos Dominus benedicit pusillos cum iustioribus.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit exposicio uenerabilis Bede presbiteri de templo Salomonis

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Commentary on the Catholic Epistles
msItem.rubric: Incipit in epistola Iacobi apostoli exposicio uenerabilis Bede presbiteri.
msItem.incipit: Iacobus Dei domini nostri I. C. seruus
msItem.explicit: non ab inicio temporis alicuius sed autem omne seculum et nunc et in omnia s. s. amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit exposicio uenerabilis Bede in epistola Iude apostoli

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Commentary on Acts
msItem.rubric: Incipit prefacio uenerabilis Bede presbiteri in Actus Apostolorum missa Acce episcopo.
msItem.incipit: Domino in Christo desiderantissimo
Accepi creberrimas beatitudinis tue litteras
Primum quidem sermonem feci ...; De omnibus se dicit Christi factis et dictis in euuangelio scripsisse
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Beda super Actus apostolorum complete

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Nomina Regionum atque Locorum de Actibus Apostolorum
msItem.incipit: Acheldemac est ager sanguinis

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Homilies on the Gospels
msItem.rubric: Omelie uenerabilis Bede per totum annum.
msItem.incipit: Aduentum dominice predicacionis
msItem.finalRubric: Laus tibi sit Christe per quem liber explicit iste.
msItem.note: In the order i. 1–2, 5–6, 3–4, 7–12, 14, 19, 15, 18, Ambrosius Autpertus 2, Bede 17, 24, 22, 25, ii. 6, 1, i. 23, ii. 2, 4, i. 13 (to p. 91 line 99), then an interpolation found in other copies, ‘Nam iuxta quod reuerentissimus de eo papa Gregorius luculenti ueracissimoque memorat relatu ... si petentium fides exigat miraculis choruscat prestante ...’, the effect of which is to change the homily’s subject from Benedict Biscop to Benedict of Nursia, ii. 3, 5, (bk. II) ii. 7, 9, 8, 10, 13, 11–12, 14–20, i. 20, ii. 22, 21, 23–5, i. 21, 16, Bede, Super Marcum iii. 9 (Grégoire, p. 468).

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Nomina Regionum atque Locorum de Actibus Apostolorum
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber de descriptione situs terre a beato Beda prouinciarum, ciuitatum, insularum huic libro congruentium.
msItem.incipit: Acheldemach est ager sanguinis
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit libe in Dei nomine exposicionis Bede presbiteri in actus apostolorum, canc. and replaced, in another hand Explicit liber de descripcione situs terre ...

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: In Libros Regum Quaestiones XXX
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola Bede presbiteri ad Nothelmum de xxx. questionibus.
msItem.incipit: Dilectissimo fratri Nothelmo Beda salutem. Que de libro Regum dilucidanda
Quod ait propheta ad Hely loquens ex persona Dei
msItem.explicit: intrate in gaudium Domini uestri qui ...

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Commentary on Luke
msItem.incipit: Reuerendissimo in Christo fratri et consacerdoti
Sepe quidem tue sancte fraternitatis et absens
Domino beatissimo et nimium desideratissimo
Mira uere est et uera mira
De omnibus que fecit Iesus factus est docere

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Commentary on the Song of Songs
msItem.note: Capitula followed by the complete text of Cant. to fol. 201v.
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Bede contra Iulianum diuine gratie repugnatorem.
msItem.incipit: Scripturus Dei iuuante gratia in cantica canticorum primo
Cantica canticorum in quibus sapientissimus regum Salomon misteria Christi et ecclesie
msItem.finalRubric:
Beda Dei famulus nostri didascalus eui
falce pia sophie ueterum satalatam peragrans ... requie Deo felix feliciter et lege semper.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Commentary on Proverbs
msItem.incipit: Parabole Salomonis filii Dauid regis. Parabole grece latine dicuntur similitudines

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Nomina Regionum atque Locorum de Actibus Apostolorum
msItem.incipit: Item de nominibus locorum ut patet per sanctum Orosium libro suo 7 de Ormesta. Acheldemach ager sanguinis

msItem.author: Pseudo-Bede
msItem.title: De Ponderibus et Mensuris
msItem.incipit: Ponderum ac mensurarum iuuat congnoscere modum
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Beda de ponderibus et mensuris.

msItem.author: JOHN SHARPE
msItem.title: De Orationibus Sanctorum, de Suffragiis Viatorum et de Pluralitate Beneficiorum
msItem.incipit: Reuerendi magistri et domini cum secundum seriem euangelii omnis plantacio
msItem.explicit: ad collacionem gracie et defunctis ad mitigacionem pene ... et definitis ad mitigacionem pene &c.
msItem.note: ‘M. Iohannis Scherpe’ is scribbled in the upper margin of fol. 263.
Unpr.; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 315; one of three copies.

msItem.author: JOHN SHARPE
msItem.title: De Potestate Sacerdotii
msItem.incipit: Ad sacrificandum ut panem et uinum
msItem.note: Unpr.; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 315; the unique copy.

Followed by two notes: (1) ‘Licet curacio funeris et condicio sepulture seu pompa exequiarum magis sint uiuorum consolacio quam subsidia mortuorum non tamen contempnenda et abicienda sunt corpora defunctorum ...’; (2) ‘Nota quod anno 13. natiuitatis sue beate uirgo in utero concepit filium suum ...’.

msItem.title: Anon. treatise on the BVM
msItem.incipit: Ave Maria gratia plena. De cuius plenitudine omnes accepimus graciam pro gracia
msItem.explicit: ut Eua iam non dicatur mater uiuencium sed Maria.
msItem.finalRubric: Thouȝ pu were neuere so gret a theef pi modyr wold not se pe hangyd. Sic Maria licet turpissimus peccator te dampnari nollet quia mater tua est.

msItem.author: WALTER HILTON
msItem.title: De Adoratione Imaginum
msItem.incipit: Numquid Domini nostri Ihesu Christi crucifixi beate uirginis Marie ac reliquorum sanctorum ymagines licite in ecclesiis poni
msItem.explicit: dicit diuinam essenciam non est dicencia.
msItem.note: Ed. J. P. H. Clark and C. Taylor, Analecta Cartusiana 124 (Salzburg, 1987), pp. 179–214; Sharpe, Handlist, pp. 316, 735; J. M. Russel-Smith, ‘Walter Hilton and a tract in defence of the veneration of images’, Dominican Studies 7 (1954), 180–214.

msItem.author: JOHN DEVEROSE
msItem.title: De Materia Peregrinationis
msItem.incipit: In materia peregrinacionis dicendum est Licitum est hominibus peregrinari ad reliquias sanctorum
msItem.note: Unpr.; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 235, one of four copies.

msItem.author: PETRUS ALFONSI
msItem.title: Dialogus contra Iudaeos, extract
msItem.incipit: Quid adhuc quasi in thesauro reseruaui tibi quod cum apposuero te absque defencione confido superari posse
Hec Petrus Alfonsus. Iste Petrus primo fuit hereticus et uocabatur Moyses postea cum factus fuisset catholicus uocabatur Petrus
msItem.explicit: et alius catholicus Christianus Deo gratias.
msItem.note: PL 157. 670A-2; ed. K. P. Meith (Berlin, 1982); Diaz 893; Reinhardt 250–8.

msItem.title: Commentary on John 1
msItem.incipit: In principio ...; Secundum glossam quatuor in hac parte recitatur Hoc uerbum erat
msItem.explicit: (ends unfinished in 1: 11) necessarium Deus dimitteret atten’
msItem.note: The most recent authorities quoted are Aquinas, Bonaventure, Duns Scotus, ‘Doctor solemnis’ (Henry of Ghent), Grosseteste and Bradwardine.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: Retractatio on Acts
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus retractationis in Actus Apostolorum.
msItem.incipit: Scimus eximium doctorem ac pontificem Augustinum
Primum quidem sermonem feci ...; Quod ait primum quidem non est aduerbum ordinis

supportDesc.extent:
327 leaves (i + 326) 380 260
270–85 185–90
The edges retrimmed with loss of marginalia and stained yellow.
supportDesc.collation: A singleton, 1–2112, 2210, 2312(+ 1 after 12), 24–712, 284(4 canc.); catchwords in banderoles.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled with pencil in 2 cols., written in c. 55–60 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Several scribes, of widely varying competence: an anglicana hand fols. 1–96v; secretary, probably Continental, fols. 97–154; anglicana fols. 157–62v, 317v-25v; an extraordinarily rough and uncalligraphic cursive which annotates earlier on, with occasional short passages by the previous hand fols. 163–200 and art. 14; a highly proficient upright anglicana formata fols. 200v-56; similar, but forward-slanting and tremulous art. 13; an anglicana hand fols. 263–317.

decoDesc.decoNote: Hardly any; unfilled spaces for coloured initials and rubrics; art. 7 is rubricated; arts. 11–12 have rubrics and running heads in red.

binding.p: Oxford, s. xvi in.: thick bevelled oak boards with slightly projecting squares, covered with blind-stamped brown calf, rebacked; resewn on five bands; formerly two straps from the front board to catches at the back, replaced s. xvii by cloth ties. Near the head of the rear cover were inked titles, of which ‘Opera quedam uenerabilis [Bedae]’ can still be read; below is ‘Liber ?.17.us’. Formerly chained from two positions at the foredge of the front board, near the foot; the lower one has not affected the front pastedown. Inside the back board are marks of the large brass chain-staple; these do not affect the leather cover. The binder who applied the cover was George Chastelaine (Oldham’s ‘Fruit and Flower Binder’), d. 1513, for whom see MS 119; here he used Oldham’s stamps 179, 180, 182, 184, 191, and the half-stamp Pearson 7.

origin.origPlace: script of English and Continental appearance.

history.provenance: At the head of fol. i is ‘Liber domus scolarium de Mertone in Oxonia ut incathenetur in libraria eiusdem ad communem utilitatem ibidem studere uolencium ex dono magistri Henrici Seuer sacre theologie professoris ac custodis domus predicte. Oretis igitur pro eo.’ For Sever, warden 1455–71, see MS 6.

At the head of the front pastedown is ‘B. lier. 17us’ in the usual hand (see above, MS 60). Further down is ‘O. 7. 3. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced with ‘K. 3. 3 (CLXXV)’ in red; the College bookplate.
Seen at Merton by John Bale (Appendix C, no. 6).
At the head of fol. 1 is the James no. ‘229’, s. xvii in. ‘3’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
